comments:
We have a huge java product with thousends of java source files.
The product is swing based but we use a lot of own swing extensions.

I created a JPanel based visual class by VE.
Exit Eclipse and start it again.
After a while Eclipse cannot open the class with VE. It writes only 
'Setup Java Visual Editor: (25%)' on the status bar of Eclipse and the progress
bar is 'running' beside the text.
The CPU usage of the pc is around 55 % which actually means 100% since Windows
recognizes 2 CPUs but the PC has only one phisically.

I use Eclipse 3.1RC2, and VE 1.1M2.
This bug occured with the former versions of VE 1.1 branch, but didn't occur
when we used the 1.0 branch, so 6 month ago.

It seems that on exit Eclipse writes something wrong into the metadata
directory. I saved the .plugin directory of the workspace and when the bug
occured I replaced the current .plugins directory with the saved one.
After automatic build of the whole project (10 minutes) the file can be opened
with VE. But if I restart Eclipse it cannot be opened again. 

In the log file I cannot find any error messages while VE is trying to open the
class.

Oooops... I've just realized that VE was able to open the file but after 
about 10 minutes. I left it in the background to work while I was writing
this bug report. But this 10 minutes is also unacceptable.

Just for information:
Eclipse 3.0.2 with VE 20050504 works properly.

The errors mentioned in #6 appear with Eclipse 3.0.2/VE 20050504 in the log
file, too.

So it might not be the reason of the bug in the 3.1 branch.

It seems that in 3.1 there is an endless loop somewhere which practically blocks
Eclipse (and also the whole computer) and beside that VE can work in its own setup
thread very slowly.

Again, since I find it very important:
the bug doesn't occur when the projects are newly checked out from repository
into an empty workspace directory or if I replace the .metadata/.plugins
directory with the original one.

Two things:

1) The UIDefaults.getUI is an error, but it looks like it is because you are
trying to use a LookAndFeel that is not available at design time. Are you trying
to use your own special LookAndFeel? If you are, that LookAndFeel class and
everything it needs should be put onto your classpath too.

2) I can't tell exactly what is happening from the trace from the ctrl+break. I
have an idea, but I'm not sure. Try this, the next it occurs, after it comes out
after ten minutes, do a Project->Clean...->All projects, then close the project
and reopen it, and then open the editor.  See if it works this time. If it does,
then I have a better clue of where the problem is at. 

Do you have a small example, non-confidential class that fails that you could
send me? It doesn't appear to be an infinite loop but it is in a strange place
from the trace. I can't imagine why it would be so slow except if there was an
absolutely huge BeanInfo.

Do you have a BeanInfo for these classes? If you do, could that be sent to me if
non-confidential?

Could you please append another ctrl+break trace (though it would be better to
put it into a text file and attach it using the "Create New Attachment" link on
the bugzilla page).

I'm assuming you are still on VE1.1M2. If so, I'm sending a file directly to
you. It is a possible patch for the problem. I'd like you to give it a try and
see if it fixes it. You don't receive the file please let me know and I'll
attach here instead. I didn't want to clutter up bugzilla with test patches.
With the sent patch VE works properly.
The changes have been released to HEAD.
VE 1.1 is released. Moving to closed.
